page.title: 11FARMING
page.content: killer etc are applied as necessary. Animals sprayed and dipped as required The advantages of farming in the area is seen as good lush grass; isolated, remote (albeit with high haulage costs )and peacefully set in hunting country The disadvantage: land available for arable crops is limited; cattle must be wintered indoors leading to high food and labour inputs; long hours; milk quotas. {Bonds Fm}The dairy and milk farm of some 30 ha run by Arthur T. Darch and his son. Animals are 30 Friesian cows for milk, 80 Border Leicester and Exmoor Horn ewes are kept for fat lamb production.{Thule Fm A mixed farm of 53 ha with 0.4 ha of woodland run by Christopher D Shapland a third generation owner - since 1895. Animals kept are sheep (wool and meat) beef cattle (meat) & chickens (eggs). Two people employed. {Lakehead Fm A
